memberdef.name: SCIP_DECL_QUADCONSUPGD
memberdef.initializer: SCIP_RETCODE x (SCIP* scip, SCIP_CONS* cons, \ int nbinlin, int nbinquad, int nintlin, int nintquad, int nimpllin, int nimplquad, int ncontlin, int ncontquad, \ SCIP_Bool integral, int* nupgdconss, SCIP_CONS** upgdconss, int upgdconsssize)

detaileddescription.para: upgrading method for quadratic constraints into more specific constraints

the method might upgrade a quadratic constraint into a set of quadratic constraints the caller provided an array upgdconss to store upgrade constraints the length of upgdconss is given by upgdconsssize if an upgrade is not possible, set *nupgdconss to zero if more than upgdconsssize many constraints shall replace cons, the function should return the required number as negated value in *nupgdconss i.e., if cons should be replaced by 3 constraints, the function should set *nupgdconss to -3 and return with SCIP_OKAY

input:
scip : SCIP main data structure
cons : the quadratic constraint to upgrade
nbinlin : number of binary variables in linear part
nbinquad : number of binary variables in quadratic part
nintlin : number of integer variables in linear part
nintquad : number of integer variables in quadratic part
nimpllin : number of implicit integer variables in linear part
nimplquad : number of implicit integer variables in quadratic part
ncontlin : number of continuous variables in linear part
ncontquad : number of continuous variables in quadratic part
integral : TRUE iff constraints activity value is always integral
nupgdconss : pointer to store number of constraints that replace this constraint
upgdconss : array to store constraints that replace this constraint
upgdconsssize : length of the provided upgdconss array
event data for variable bound changes in quadratic constraints
creates the handler for quadratic constraints and includes it in SCIP

memberdef.argsstring: (SCIP *scip, SCIP_DECL_QUADCONSUPGD((*quadconsupgd)), int priority, SCIP_Bool active, const char *conshdlrname)
memberdef.name: SCIPincludeQuadconsUpgrade

briefdescription.para: should the upgrading method be active by default?

detaileddescription.para: includes a quadratic constraint upgrade method into the quadratic constraint handler

memberdef.argsstring: (SCIP *scip, SCIP_CONS **cons, const char *name, int nlinvars, SCIP_VAR **linvars, SCIP_Real *lincoefs, int nquadterms, SCIP_VAR **quadvars1, SCIP_VAR **quadvars2, SCIP_Real *quadcoeffs, SCIP_Real lhs, SCIP_Real rhs, SCIP_Bool initial, SCIP_Bool separate, SCIP_Bool enforce, SCIP_Bool check, SCIP_Bool propagate, SCIP_Bool local, SCIP_Bool modifiable, SCIP_Bool dynamic, SCIP_Bool removable)
memberdef.name: SCIPcreateConsQuadratic

briefdescription.para: pointer to hold the created constraint
variables in linear part (x_i) or NULL if nlinvars == 0
coefficients of variables in linear part (b_i) or NULL if nlinvars == 0
array with first variables in quadratic terms (y_j) or NULL if nquadterms == 0
array with second variables in quadratic terms (z_j) or NULL if nquadterms == 0
array with coefficients of quadratic terms (a_j) or NULL if nquadterms == 0
left hand side of quadratic equation (l)
right hand side of quadratic equation (u)
should the LP relaxation of constraint be in the initial LP? Usually set to TRUE. Set to FALSE for 'lazy constraints'.
should the constraint be separated during LP processing? Usually set to TRUE.
should the constraint be enforced during node processing? TRUE for model constraints, FALSE for additional, redundant constraints.
should the constraint be checked for feasibility? TRUE for model constraints, FALSE for additional, redundant constraints.
should the constraint be propagated during node processing? Usually set to TRUE.
is constraint only valid locally? Usually set to FALSE. Has to be set to TRUE, e.g., for branching constraints.
is constraint modifiable (subject to column generation)? Usually set to FALSE. In column generation applications, set to TRUE if pricing adds coefficients to this constraint.
is constraint subject to aging? Usually set to FALSE. Set to TRUE for own cuts which are separated as constraints.
should the relaxation be removed from the LP due to aging or cleanup? Usually set to FALSE. Set to TRUE for 'lazy constraints' and 'user cuts'.

detaileddescription.para: Creates and captures a quadratic constraint.
The constraint should be given in the form \[ \ell \leq \sum_{i=1}^n b_i x_i + \sum_{j=1}^m a_j y_j z_j \leq u, \] where $x_i = y_j = z_k$ is possible.

simplesect.para: the constraint gets captured, hence at one point you have to release it using the method SCIPreleaseCons()

memberdef.argsstring: (SCIP *scip, SCIP_CONS **cons, const char *name, int nlinvars, SCIP_VAR **linvars, SCIP_Real *lincoefs, int nquadterms, SCIP_VAR **quadvars1, SCIP_VAR **quadvars2, SCIP_Real *quadcoefs, SCIP_Real lhs, SCIP_Real rhs)
memberdef.name: SCIPcreateConsBasicQuadratic

briefdescription.para: pointer to hold the created constraint
array with variables in linear part (x_i)
array with coefficients of variables in linear part (b_i)
array with first variables in quadratic terms (y_j)
array with second variables in quadratic terms (z_j)
array with coefficients of quadratic terms (a_j)
left hand side of quadratic equation (ell)
right hand side of quadratic equation (u)

detaileddescription.para: creates and captures a quadratic constraint in its most basic variant, i. e., with all constraint flags set to their default values, which can be set afterwards using SCIPsetConsFLAGNAME() in scip.h
The constraint should be given in the form \[ \ell \leq \sum_{i=1}^n b_i x_i + \sum_{j=1}^m a_j y_jz_j \leq u, \] where $x_i = y_j = z_k$ is possible.

simplesect.para: SCIPcreateConsQuadratic() for the default constraint flag configuration
the constraint gets captured, hence at one point you have to release it using the method SCIPreleaseCons()

memberdef.name: SCIPcreateConsQuadratic2

briefdescription.para: pointer to hold the created constraint
array with variables in linear part (x_i)
array with coefficients of variables in linear part (b_i)
should the LP relaxation of constraint be in the initial LP?
should the constraint be separated during LP processing?
should the constraint be enforced during node processing?
should the constraint be checked for feasibility?
should the constraint be propagated during node processing?
is constraint modifiable (subject to column generation)?
should the constraint be removed from the LP due to aging or cleanup?

detaileddescription.para: creates and captures a quadratic constraint.
The constraint should be given in the form \[ \ell \leq \sum_{i=1}^n b_i x_i + \sum_{j=1}^m (a_j y_j^2 + b_j y_j) + \sum_{k=1}^p c_k v_k w_k \leq u. \]

simplesect.para: the constraint gets captured, hence at one point you have to release it using the method SCIPreleaseCons()

memberdef.argsstring: (SCIP *scip, SCIP_CONS **cons, const char *name, int nlinvars, SCIP_VAR **linvars, SCIP_Real *lincoefs, int nquadvarterms, SCIP_QUADVARTERM *quadvarterms, int nbilinterms, SCIP_BILINTERM *bilinterms, SCIP_Real lhs, SCIP_Real rhs)

briefdescription.para: pointer to hold the created constraint

detaileddescription.para: creates and captures a quadratic constraint in its most basic variant, i. e., with all constraint flags set to their default values, which can be set afterwards using SCIPsetConsFLAGNAME() in scip.h
The constraint should be given in the form \[ \ell \leq \sum_{i=1}^n b_i x_i + \sum_{j=1}^m (a_j y_j^2 + b_j y_j) + \sum_{k=1}^p c_kv_kw_k \leq u. \]

simplesect.para: SCIPcreateConsQuadratic2() for the default constraint flag configuration
the constraint gets captured, hence at one point you have to release it using the method SCIPreleaseCons()

briefdescription.para: constant to subtract from both sides

detaileddescription.para: Adds a constant to the constraint function, that is, subtracts a constant from both sides
Adds a linear variable with coefficient to a quadratic constraint.

memberdef.name: SCIPaddQuadVarQuadratic

detaileddescription.para: Adds a quadratic variable with linear and square coefficient to a quadratic constraint.

briefdescription.para: value to add to linear coefficient of variable

detaileddescription.para: Adds a linear coefficient for a quadratic variable.
Variable will be added with square coefficient 0.0 if not existing yet.

briefdescription.para: value to add to square coefficient of variable

detaileddescription.para: Adds a square coefficient for a quadratic variable.
Variable will be added with linear coefficient 0.0 if not existing yet.
Adds a bilinear term to a quadratic constraint.
Variables will be added with linear and square coefficient 0.0 if not existing yet. If variables are equal, only the square coefficient of the variable is updated.
Gets the quadratic constraint as a nonlinear row representation.
Gets the number of variables in the linear part of a quadratic constraint.
Gets the variables in the linear part of a quadratic constraint. Length is given by SCIPgetNLinearVarsQuadratic.
Gets the coefficients in the linear part of a quadratic constraint. Length is given by SCIPgetNQuadVarsQuadratic.
Gets the number of quadratic variable terms of a quadratic constraint.
Gets the quadratic variable terms of a quadratic constraint. Length is given by SCIPgetNQuadVarTermsQuadratic.
Ensures that quadratic variable terms are sorted.

briefdescription.para: buffer to store position of quadvarterm for var, or -1 if not found

detaileddescription.para: Finds the position of a quadratic variable term for a given variable.

simplesect.para: If the quadratic variable terms have not been sorted before, then a search may reorder the current order of the terms.

detaileddescription.para: Gets the number of bilinear terms of a quadratic constraint.
Gets the bilinear terms of a quadratic constraint. Length is given by SCIPgetNBilinTermQuadratic.
Gets the left hand side of a quadratic constraint.
Gets the right hand side of a quadratic constraint.
Check the quadratic function of a quadratic constraint for its semi-definiteness, if not done yet.
Indicates whether the quadratic function of a quadratic constraint is (known to be) convex.
Indicates whether the quadratic function of a quadratic constraint is (known to be) concave.

briefdescription.para: solution which violation to calculate, or NULL for LP solution
pointer to store violation of constraint

detaileddescription.para: Gets the violation of a constraint by a solution.
Indicates whether the quadratic constraint is local w.r.t. the current local bounds.
That is, checks whether each variable with a square term is fixed and for each bilinear term at least one variable is fixed.

briefdescription.para: NLPI problem where to add constraint
mapping from SCIP variables to variable indices in NLPI
whether to pass constraint names to NLPI

detaileddescription.para: Adds the constraint to an NLPI problem.

briefdescription.para: constraint handler for quadratic constraints $\textrm{lhs} \leq \sum_{i,j=1}^n a_{i,j} x_ix_j + \sum_{i=1}^n b_i x_i \leq \textrm{rhs}$

detaileddescription.para: Stefan Vigerske This constraint handler handles constraints of the form \[ \textrm{lhs} \leq \sum_{i,j=1}^n a_{i,j} x_ix_j + \sum_{i=1}^n b_i x_i \leq \textrm{rhs} \]
Constraints are enforced by separation, domain propagation, and spatial branching.

For semidefinite matrices $A=(a_{i,j})_{i,j}$, cuts based on linearization of $\langle x, Ax\rangle$ are implemented. For underestimating a non-convex term, McCormick underestimators and secants for univariate concave quadratic terms are implemented. If $\langle x, Ax\rangle$ is factorable (i.e., can be written as product of two linear functions), specialized separation techniques (e.g., lifted tangent inequalities) that take the constraint sides into account are applied.
Branching is performed for variables in nonconvex terms, if the relaxation solution cannot be separated. Further, domain propagation is applied.
During presolve, variable products which contain binary variables may be reformulated into linear constraints, thereby introducing new variables.

See also
Timo Berthold and Stefan Heinz and Stefan Vigerske Extending a CIP framework to solve MIQCPs In: Jon Lee and Sven Leyffer (eds.), Mixed-integer nonlinear optimization: Algorithmic advances and applications, IMA volumes in Mathematics and its Applications, volume 154, 427-444, 2012.
Stefan Vigerske Decomposition of Multistage Stochastic Programs and a Constraint Integer Programming Approach to Mixed-Integer Nonlinear Programming PhD Thesis, Humboldt-University Berlin, 2012, submitted.
Pietro Belotti and Andrew J. Miller and Mahdi Namazifar Linear inequalities for bounded products of variables SIAG/OPT Views-and-News 22:1, 1-8, 2011.
